intro: Callitriche platycarpa f. caespititia, commonly known as the clustered bladderwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is characterized by its small, green, floating leaves that are often clustered together, giving it its common name. The plant produces tiny, white flowers that bloom in early summer, typically in shallow freshwater environments. It is an aquatic or semi-aquatic species, often found in still or slow-moving waters. Its reproductive strategy involves both self-pollination and cross-pollination, contributing to its adaptability in various wetland habitats.
